articles.headline: With O’Donnell as Foil, Democrat Plays It Safe
articles.snippet: In the Delaware Senate race, Chris Coons’s campaign frames Christine O’Donnell’s statements in a deadpan manner.
articles.abstract: In the Delaware Senate race, Chris Coons’s campaign frames Christine O’Donnell’s statements in a deadpan manner.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW CASTLE, Del.  When Chris Coons was asked last week about a new television commercial in which his rival in this state’s Senate race, Christine O’Donnell, assured voters that she was not a witch, his smile was controlled and very, very brief.

articles.headline: In Hungary, Mogul Finds Fertile Area for Software
articles.snippet: Michael Simon, a technology entrepreneur, has repeatedly enlisted Hungarian engineers to build successful start-ups.
articles.abstract: Michael Simon, a technology entrepreneur, has repeatedly enlisted Hungarian engineers to build successful start-ups.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  On a whim, Michael Simon sprinted off to Hungary after finishing business school in St. Louis. Twenty years later, he has carved out an unusual niche as perhaps Hungary’s most successful software entrepreneur.

articles.headline: U.S. Alarmed by Harsh Tone of China’s Military
articles.snippet: American military officials are worried about a shift in which young Chinese may see the U.S. only as a threat.
articles.abstract: American military officials are worried about a shift in which young Chinese may see the U.S. only as a threat.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING  Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates met his Chinese counterpart, Liang Guanglie, in Vietnam on Monday for the first time since the two militaries suspended talks with each other last winter, calling for the two countries to prevent “mistrust, miscalculations and mistakes.”

articles.headline: Supreme Court to Consider Vaccine Case
articles.snippet: The Supreme Court’s review of the no-fault system for vaccines could have an effect on hundreds of lawsuits over childhood vaccines and autism.
articles.abstract: The Supreme Court’s review of the no-fault system for vaccines could have an effect on hundreds of lawsuits over childhood vaccines and autism.
articles.lead_paragraph: The safety of vaccines is at the heart of a case expected to be heard on Tuesday by the United States Supreme Court, one that could have implications for hundreds of lawsuits that contend there is a link between vaccines and autism.

articles.headline: Ohio Attorney General Fights Against Wall Street
articles.snippet: Richard Cordray is giving full throat to popular outrage by suing firms involved in the financial crisis.
articles.abstract: Richard Cordray is giving full throat to popular outrage by suing firms involved in the financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Back East, at the corner of Broad and Wall Streets, the view is swell. The Dow is soaring, and bankers look pleased.

articles.headline: A Foreclosure Tightrope for Democrats
articles.snippet: Outcry over foreclosures has thrust the Obama administration back into the position of sheltering the banking industry from an angry public’s demands.
articles.abstract: Outcry over foreclosures has thrust the Obama administration back into the position of sheltering the banking industry from an angry public’s demands.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The swelling outcry over fast-and-loose foreclosures has thrust the Obama administration back into the uncomfortable position of sheltering the banking industry from the demands of an angry public.

articles.headline: Worrying Over China and Food
articles.snippet: The prospect that a group backed by China may try to take over a fertilizer company has alarmed Washington, Canada and Wall Street.
articles.abstract: The prospect that a group backed by China may try to take over a fertilizer company has alarmed Washington, Canada and Wall Street.

articles.headline: Inspectors in Rearview as Food Trucks Rule Road
articles.snippet: Los Angeles County will vote on Tuesday on whether to hold food trucks to the same health rules as restaurants.
articles.abstract: Los Angeles County will vote on Tuesday on whether to hold food trucks to the same health rules as restaurants.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  This is the place where food trucks really first took to the streets, catering to fanatical customers who relished  along with the food  the renegade and slightly outlaw nature of the whole business.

articles.headline: Offering Donors Secrecy, and Going on Attack
articles.snippet: The impact of political groups awash in money from hidden sources has made them a campaign issue.
articles.abstract: The impact of political groups awash in money from hidden sources has made them a campaign issue.
articles.lead_paragraph: The American Future Fund, a conservative organization based in Iowa, has been one of the more active players in this fall’s campaigns, spending millions of dollars on ads attacking Democrats across the country. It has not hesitated to take credit for its attacks, issuing press releases with headlines like “AFF Launches TV Ads in 13 States Targeting Liberal Politicians.”
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg, Don Van Natta Jr. and Mike McIntire
